title: NOX_WATCH ultra-modern marketing website (Home, Catalog, About, Contact)

requirements.text: Create a site-wide layout for NOX_WATCH with a responsive top navigation (Home, Catalog, About, Contact), a consistent header/footer, and a clean white + blue visual system (typography, spacing, buttons, cards) suitable for a premium watch brand.

quotes: I want a professional, ultra-modern website for a watch store. The store name is NOX_WATCH.

Design requirements:
- Clean, modern, and attractive style
- White and blue color scheme
- Easy navigation and user-friendly layout

acceptanceCriteria: Navigation is visible on all pages and highlights the active route.
Design is predominantly white with blue accents (links, buttons, section highlights).
Layout is responsive across mobile/tablet/desktop with sensible spacing and readable typography.
Footer contains store name (NOX_WATCH) and essential quick links or store details.

requirements.text: Implement a Home page that showcases featured watches and highlights top/premium collections with a modern hero section, featured grid, and collection highlights; keep all content easy to customize via a single front-end config/data file (e.g., arrays for featured products and collections).

quotes: Homepage showcasing featured watches and top collections
The website should feature the best watches and highlight premium collections.
Please generate the website structure so I can easily customize images, text, layout, and design myself.

acceptanceCriteria: Home page contains: (1) hero section, (2) featured watches section, (3) premium collections section.
Featured watches and collections render from a centralized, clearly labeled data/config module (no hardcoding scattered across components).
Each featured watch shows at least: image, name, short description, and price (or price placeholder) with a clear CTA (e.g., “View details” linking to Catalog or a product section).

requirements.text: Implement a Product Catalog page that displays a grid/list of watch product cards including image, price, and description, with basic UX for browsing (responsive grid and optional simple client-side filtering/sorting that is easy to remove/customize).

quotes: Product catalog page with images, prices, and descriptions
Please generate the website structure so I can easily customize images, text, layout, and design myself.

acceptanceCriteria: Catalog page displays multiple products in a responsive grid with consistent card styling.
Each product card shows: image, product name, price, and short description.
Product list is driven by a centralized data/config module so the user can add/remove/edit products easily.
If filtering/sorting is included, it is client-side and does not require backend changes.

requirements.text: Implement an About Us page describing the NOX_WATCH store/brand, including the owner name (NAEEM) and a premium-brand narrative; keep copy easy to customize (centralized data or clearly editable text sections).

quotes: About Us page describing the store

acceptanceCriteria: About page includes store name (NOX_WATCH) and owner name (NAEEM).
Page contains at least two sections (e.g., brand story, quality/premium promise) with clean typography and spacing.
All text is in English and easy to find/edit.

requirements.text: Implement a Contact page containing (1) store details and (2) a contact form with client-side validation. Store details must include: Owner Name: NAEEM, Mobile: +8801405917740, Location: Brahmanbaria Sodor, Somobei Market, 3rd Floor, Store Name: NOX_WATCH.

quotes: Contact page with a contact form and store details

Owner Name: NAEEM
- Mobile: +8801405917740
- Location: Brahmanbaria Sodor, Somobei Market, 3rd Floor, Store Name: NOX_WATCH

acceptanceCriteria: Contact page visibly displays the provided owner name, phone number, and full location text exactly as provided.
Contact form includes at minimum: name, phone/email, message fields, with clear validation errors.
On submit, the UI shows a success state (without requiring external email/SMS services).
All user-facing labels and messages are in English.

requirements.text: Add a clear, documented customization structure in the frontend so the user can easily swap images, update text, and change products/collections without touching multiple files (e.g., a single data module + reusable components for sections/cards).

quotes: Please generate the website structure so I can easily customize images, text, layout, and design myself.

acceptanceCriteria: Products, collections, and store details are defined in one central place (or a small, clearly documented set of files).
Components read from that data module to render Home/Catalog/About/Contact content.
There is a short inline comment block or a simple “Customization” section in code explaining what to edit to change products, collections, and store details.

requirements.text: Add required generated static images to the project under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the Home and Catalog pages as default placeholders that the user can later replace with real product photography.

quotes: Homepage showcasing featured watches and top collections
Product catalog page with images, prices, and descriptions

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are stored in frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend (no backend image routing).
Home and Catalog render using these placeholder images by default with visually consistent sizing/cropping.
User can replace images by swapping files or updating image paths in the central data module.

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Frontend must be built with React + TypeScript, Tailwind, Shadcn UI components (compose; do not edit read-only UI component sources).
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead).
Do not modify immutable hook/bootstrap files (e.g., frontend/src/main.tsx and Internet Identity hooks); build pages/components around them.
Backend is a single Motoko actor; only add backend work if strictly necessary for the requested UI.
nonGoals: E-commerce checkout, shopping cart, or payment processing.
User accounts/authentication requirements beyond any template defaults.
Third-party integrations for sending emails/SMS from the contact form.
Admin dashboard for managing products (products can be edited in a front-end data/config file).
